snippet: Its team suffered a humiliating semifinal defeat, but Brazil is taking comfort in its success as host of the World Cup and in its archrival Argentina’s loss in the final.
abstract: Jere Longman On Soccer column holds that despite host country Brazil suffering humiliating defeat on the pitch, country defied skeptics who predicted chaos, instead hosting well-organized monthlong tournament that some are calling the best World Cup in recent memory; Brazil also takes solace in its archrival Argentina's loss in the final.
lead_paragraph: Its team suffered a humiliating semifinal defeat, but Brazil is taking comfort in its success as host of the World Cup and in its archrival Argentina’s loss in the final.

headline.seo: World Cup 2014: Brazil Was a Good Host Despite Its Team's Collapse
headline.main: Success for Brazil, Just Not on the Field
headline.print_headline: Success for Brazil, Just Not on the Field
